alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 2:07PM EST until January 05 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattahoochee River near Chattahoochee River above Roswell affecting Fulton County. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Buford, Buford, Suwanee, Suwanee, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Roswell, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairplay, Whitesburg, Fairburn, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Corinth, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Franklin, West Point, Union, Columbus, Omaha...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River near Chattahoochee River above Roswell. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10 feet, Minor flooding continues. The water is one foot deep in the Ace Sand Company office and begins to flood a warehouse. Flooding expands into the parkings lots of Don White Memorial Park on Riverside Road...and the Azalea Park on Azalea Drive west of Roswell Road. Water begins to flood the tennis courts at the Huntcliff Club across from Azalea Park and is one foot deep over the road leading to the horse stables. The storm drains will stop functioning at Riverside Road and Northcliff Trace. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM EST Wednesday was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 3.9 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
